structural_unit_name.en: Department of Literature and Theatre Research

description.en: The course introduces concepts and approaches of classical and postclassical narratology. It seeks to answer the following questions: Which deep narrative structures do we use in everyday conversation without even knowing? - Why some narratives are easily remembered and some are easily forgotten? - Why are surprising story endings surprising, and intriguing plot twists intriguing? - How do different types of narratives engage the reader (viewer, user)?
description.et: Tutvutakse klassikalise narratoloogia põhimõistete ja -tekstidega, samuti  uuemate narratiiviuurimuslike lähenemistega, nagu mitteverbaalsete meediumite abil jutustamine, jutustamine ja kognitsioon. Kursus otsib vastuseid küsimustele: millised narratsiooni süvastruktuurid ilmnevad nii argisuhtluses kui ka fiktsionaalsetes narratiivides? miks ühed lood jäävad hästi meelde ja teised ununevad kiiresti? mil moel lugu meid kaasa haarab?

objectives.en: Narratology has become an expanding area of interdisciplinary research in rapid development. Narratological tools are used to study political, scientific, and literary texts and to explain human behavior. Movies, comic books, and video games are organized as stories which offer rich material for narrative analysis. The course introduces major theoretical and methodological tools of narratology, including both classical and most recent approaches, and develops skills of practical analysis of narratives in various media.
objectives.et:
Narratoloogiast on tänapäeval saanud kiiresti arenev interdistsiplinaarne uurimisvaldkond, mille tööriistu kasutatakse poliitiliste, teaduslike ja kirjanduslike tekstide ning inimkäitumise uurimisel. Filmid, koomiksid ja videomängud on vaadeldud lugudena, mis pakuvad rikkalikku materjali narratiivseks analüüsiks.
Kursus tutvustab narratoloogia põhimõisteid ning tänapäeva narratiiviuurimuslikke meetodeid, lähenemisi ja probleeme. Praktiline töö hõlmab teoreetilist diskussiooni, narratiivsete tekstide tõlgendust ja analüüsi, praktiliste ülesannete täitmist.

learning_outcomes.en: The students will receive theoretical knowledge of the basic narratological concepts and methods. On the successful completion of the course, students should be able 1) to describe and critically analyze key concepts and methods of classical narratology; 2) to understand and describe the most recent narratological developments, 3) to orient themselves in narratological methods and approaches and 4) to apply them in practice.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilased saavad ülevaate narratoloogia tekkest ja arengust ning omandavad narratiiviuurimuslike meetodite rakendamise oskused.

description.et: Students are expected to participate in seminar work and classroom discussion, and to complete short practical exercises

In their research papers, students are expected to apply methods or approaches discussed in the course to a freely chosen sample of materials (fictional or nonfictional texts, films, video games, samples of online communication or public speech, etc.).

grade_preconditions.et:
- passing the Moodle test (at least 70% of the score)
- participation in seminars and e-learning 
- research paper

grade_evaluation.et:
- research paper, min 2500 words (50%). 
- test (25%) 
- participation in seminars, class discussions and e-learning (25%)

description.et: What is narrative? What is narratology?  The study of narrative in the humanities, arts, and sciences.  The basic elements of narrative: story, plot, emplotment (prof. Marina Grishakova)

topic.et: The basic elements of narrative: classical narratology

description.et: The basic elements of narrative. Narrative sequence, causality, event. Temporality, perspective, voice. Basic narrative typologies and practical applications: fairy tales, hero’s journey and non-western narrative patterns (dr. Francesca Arnavas)
Complex and experimental forms of narration in contemporary culture (systems novel, complex film and TV). Narrative and the study of complexity  (Mattia Bellini) + Homework: Moodle test
